qas.question: What did John XXIII die of?
How old was John XXIII upon his death?
Who celebrated his Mass for him in the square below?

plausible_answers.text: peritonitis caused by a perforated stomach

qas.question: What did Luigi Traglia die of?
What was done to Luigi Traglia's brow to see if he was dead?
When did John XXIII pray at Luigi Traglia's tomb?

context: John XXIII died of <a0_0><b5_0>peritonitis<a0_0/> caused by a perforated stomach<b5_0/> <b6_0>at 19:49 local time on <a1_0>3 June 1963<b6_0/><a1_0/> at the age of <a2_0>81<a2_0/>, ending a historic pontificate of four years and seven months. He died just as a Mass for him finished in Saint Peter's Square below, celebrated by <a3_0>Luigi Traglia<a3_0/>. After he died, <b7_0>his brow was ritually tapped<b7_0/> to see if he was dead, and those with him in the room said prayers. Then the room was illuminated, thus informing the people of what had happened. He was buried on <a4_0>6 June<a4_0/> <b8_0>in the Vatican grottos<b8_0/>. Two wreaths, placed on the two sides of his tomb, were donated by the prisoners of the Regina Coeli prison and the Mantova jail in Verona. <b9_0>On 22 June 1963<b9_0/>, one day after his friend and successor Pope Paul VI was elected, the latter prayed at his tomb.
